nodes.bodyText:
This would need to be of type FeedRange soon. https://github.com/FabianMeiswinkel/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/models/FeedRange.java
I think we have 3 Options:

Keep it String here, to avoid breaking change use the FeedRange.toSjon as the value and expect customers to do the transformations upstream
Make a breaking change to this preview contract when I merge the FeedRange changes - would probably be good to set expectations with Walmart that we expect some breaking changes here
Add FeedRange as an additional field - make Id the FeedRange.toJson() - this way it doesn't break and the Id might not be very useful anymore but also doesn't really cause harm

I think 3) is an acceptable solution - le me know whether you agree/disagree

The ID here is just a regular unique identifier for the lease document inside the lease collection. In the CFP "push" case we can have multiple independent instances operating on the same feed container and possibly sharing the same lease container to check-point the state; to differentiate between then a "lease prefix' is being used.
Regarding the FeedRage, I thin that will more or less matches the lease token which defines the actual scope of a single worker which will process the feeds.
NIT: final static "consts" as class level to avoid allocation for every execution
yep, makes sense since these are also shared in the code above.
NIT: final
Same for several of the local variables below

Though these have one assignment, it will look a bit odd when compared with similar patterns in the rest of the implementation (not just CFP).
And since they are not consumed by any Reactor code as arguments down the execution path which requires as such, they don't really need to be final...
NIT: assign local variable for feedResponse.getResults() to avoid repetitive invocation of the property getter
I'll keep it as such, it is easier to read the code. The property getter does not execute any particular complex operation, it just returns an internal member.
also java compiler may inline these. so shouldn't be a perf hit.

Not sure - my style-preference would be
changeFeedProcessorState
.setEstimatedLag(0)
.setContinuationToken(latestLsn);
But feel free to ignore if the non-fluent style is what makes the code more consistent etc.
I agree, this should be fluent style - if changeFeedProcessorState supports it.
In general I prefer the same "fluidity", especially after invoking the constructor :-)
Wouldn't this indicate a critical failure - tracing as warning and ignoring unexpected backend response seems to make it harder than necessary to identify breaking changes / debug it?
_ts should always be a long - right ?

The error though unexpected (_ts system property is an epoch), it is not fatal (there's a log warning capturing this). Setting the continuation token as "null" is an indicator that the document found is not valid; i.e. we initialized CFP leases but we are yet to process any changes in this particular scope/partition.

Again - feel free to ignore for consistency etc. - I am still struggling with Java not having a clear way to distinguish ReadOnlyList in the contract. But form my intuition I would expect it to be clearly documented in the Api doc comments if a method returns an unmodifiable list - so would it make sense to add a comment along tehse lines above? Also wouldn't it make sense to also return an unmodifiable list in the short-cut - when the list is empty) above to be consistent?
yep, I've updated the doc to capture this is a read only list.
also fixed the empty list early returned case (thanks for catching that up).
Nice - thanks for taking care of this :-)

nodes.bodyText:
Capturing the comment from above...
This would need to be of type FeedRange soon. https://github.com/FabianMeiswinkel/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/models/FeedRange.java
I think we have 3 Options:
Keep it String here, to avoid breaking change use the FeedRange.toSjon as the value and expect customers to do the transformations upstream
Make a breaking change to this preview contract when I merge the FeedRange changes - would probably be good to set expectations with Walmart that we expect some breaking changes here
Add FeedRange as an additional field - make Id the FeedRange.toJson() - this way it doesn't break and the Id might not be very useful anymore but also doesn't really cause harm
I think 3) is an acceptable solution - le me know whether you agree/disagree

The lease token can be any string representing one scope for a CFP worker to operate on, including a JSON string if we want to. It will be TBD how we store it in the lease document/item to make it persistent but from the user's perspective it should not matter much since FeedRange already has a constructor that takes a string payload.
We can also consider adding a "version" property to distinguish between different implementations if that helps.
String.split(.) uses regex (CPU intensive), Use StringUtils.split instead
fixed

String.split uses regex underneath which is cpu intensive.
use StringUtils.split instead.
fixed
getLastUpdate vs getLastUpdateTime ?
isn't that implicit given the return type?
well, IMO the api method name should speak for itself without looking at the return type.
np, I can make that change
ditto
same, given the argument type isn't that "Time" part implicit?

        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        assertThat(totalLag == FEED_COUNT).as("Change Feed Processor estimated total lag").isTrue();
          
          
            
            assertThat(totalLag).equalTo(FEED_COUNT).as("...")
fixed

_ts is implementation detail. And it might get impacted by the clock skews on service side.
Its better for any application to not take dependency on this concept/value.
I will take it out; it's not needed for the customer scenario we want to enable as preview.
